Frist''' (also known as '''Billy Frist''') is an American heir, businessman, investor and philanthropist from [[Tennessee]]. ==Early life== William Robert Frist was born in [[Nashville, Tennessee]]. His father, [[Thomas F. Frist, Jr.]], is a billionaire who served as the Chairman of the [[Hospital Corporation of America]] (HCA).Geert De Lomb [https://www.nashvillepost.com/blogs/postbusiness/2009/3/31/a_scenic_snapshot_frist_style A scenic snapshot, Frist style], ''Nashville Post'', March 31, 2009 His mother, [[Patricia C. Frist]], served as a director of [[SunTrust Banks]] from 2000 to 2010.[https://www.nashvillepost.com/news/2010/9/9/suntrust_director_frist_steps_down SunTrust director Frist steps down], ''Nashville Post'', September 9, 2010 His paternal grandfather, [[Thomas F. Frist, Sr.]], was a co-founder of HCA. His paternal uncle, [[Bill Frist]], served as a [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] [[United States Senate|Senator]] from 2003 to 2007.Jennifer S. Lee, [http://cityroom.blogs.nytimes.com/2009/03/30/1840s-daguerreotype-is-sold-for-62500/?_r=1&gwh=D7AC3E0F1EAB80AFD1C7DE13297ABCC3&gwt=pay 1840s Daguerreotype Is Sold for $62,500], ''The New York Times'', March 30, 2009 Frist was educated at [[Montgomery Bell Academy]] in Nashville, where he was a wrestler.[http://www.vucommodores.com/sports/cnm/spec-rel/110111aae.html Gate 2 named in honor of Frist family], ''VU Commodores'' November 1, 2011 He graduated from [[Princeton University]].[https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=41841203&privcapId=1455728&previousCapId=274846&previousTitle=GENESCO%20INC Company Overview of Frist Capital, LLC: William R. Frist], ''Bloomberg Business'' He received a masters in business administration from the [[Harvard Business School]] in 2001.[https://www.alumni.hbs.edu/stories/Pages/story-bulletin.aspx?num=2509 GIFTS CREATE FRIST FINANCIAL AID FUND], ''Harvard Business School: Alumni Stories'', September 1, 2005 ==Career== Frist has been a Principal of [[Frist Capital]], an investment firm.[http://investor.hcahealthcare.com/leadership/board-directors/william-r-frist Hospital Corporation of America: Board of Directors: William R. Frist] He is a general partner of [[Frisco Partners]], another investment firm.[http://www.marketwatch.com/investing/stock/hca/insiders?pid=42275668 HCA Holdings Inc.: William Robert Frist], ''MarketWatch'' He serves on the Board of Directors of the Hospital Corporation of America, where he is a large shareholder. ==Philanthropy== Frist serves on the Board of Directors of the [[Frist Foundation]].[http://www.fristfoundation.org/About_Us/Directors The Frist Foundation: Directors] He serves as the Chairman and President of the Board of Trustees of the [[Frist Center for the Visual Arts]].[http://fristcenter.org/about/boards-councils Frist Center for the Visual Arts: Boards & Councils] He also serves on the Board of Trustees of Leadership Nashville.[http://leadershipnashville.org/about/board-of-trustees/ Leadership Nashville: Board of Trustees] He serves as the Second President of the Board of Trust of the [[Currey Ingram Academy]], a private school in [[Brentwood, Tennessee]].[http://www.curreyingram.org/board Currey Ingram Academy: Board of Trust] In 2011, gate 2 of the [[Vanderbilt Stadium]] of [[Vanderbilt University]] in Nashville was renamed the William R. Frist Family Gate in his honor. ==Personal life== He is married to Jennifer Frist. He has been a collector of old photographs since 1993. In 2009, he made headlines for purchasing a photograph of the [[Upper West Side]] taken in October 1848, before it was built upon, at a [[Sotheby's]] auction for US$62,500. ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Frist, William R.}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Nashville, Tennessee]] [[Category:Princeton University alumni]] [[Category:Harvard Business School alumni]] [[Category:Businesspeople from Tennessee]] [[Category:American investors]] [[Category:Hospital Corporation of America people]] [[Category:American corporate directors]] [[Category:Philanthropists from Tennessee]] [[Category:Vanderbilt University people]] [[Category:Frist family]]
